LOBL.content: it is impossible for living speech to speak on living [sur vivre?], unless it’s impossible only w/ living speech: aporia even more paralyzing
LOBL.linkedContent: it is impossible for living speech to speak on living [sur vivre?], unless it’s impossible only w/ living speech: aporia even more paralyzing

POO.content: to speak of something w/out speaking of something [literature] valid for every trace, dissociation doesn’t need to be marked by words, doesn’t require la parole, can be mute deictic, gesture of animal [trace beyond human]
POO.linkedContent: to speak of something w/out speaking of something [literature] valid for every trace, dissociation doesn’t need to be marked by words, doesn’t require la parole, can be mute deictic, gesture of animal [trace beyond human]

OOG.content: for Husserl, absolute is passage (historicity as passage of Speech, primordial Logos toward polar Telos)
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, absolute is passage (historicity as passage of Speech, primordial Logos toward polar Telos)

OOG.content: every return to the origin, an audacious move toward the origin (circulation, anticipation)
OOG.linkedContent: every return to the origin, an audacious move toward the origin (circulation, anticipation)

OOG.content: Husserl’s method: bring [passage] to consciousness, Selbstbesinnung, Verantwortung, avoid risk of inauthenticity, loss of Speech, light
OOG.linkedContent: Husserl’s method: bring [passage] to consciousness, Selbstbesinnung, Verantwortung, avoid risk of inauthenticity, loss of Speech, light

OOG.content: for Husserl, speech is historical because it is always already a response, responsibility means shouldering a word one hears spoken > look after the advance of sense
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, speech is historical because it is always already a response, responsibility means shouldering a word one hears spoken > look after the advance of sense

SPOM.content: spectacularizing speculation, theatricalization of speech, no shut-eye > so intent to watch the return (à guetter la retour) [on imaginary screen]
SPOM.linkedContent: spectacularizing speculation, theatricalization of speech, no shut-eye > so intent to watch the return (à guetter la retour) [on imaginary screen]

HERP.content: philein—to accord oneself to logos (Sprache, legein, which is already engaged, opened), co-respond, correspondence (not first w/ some subject)
HERP.linkedContent: philein—to accord oneself to logos (Sprache, legein, which is already engaged, opened), co-respond, correspondence (not first w/ some subject)

MPM.content: de Man “parodies” Die Sprache spricht w/ Die Sprache verspricht—language promises (itself), no originary Sprechen modalized into promise [would Heidegger protest?] [see S p. 93-4]
MPM.linkedContent: de Man “parodies” Die Sprache spricht w/ Die Sprache verspricht—language promises (itself), no originary Sprechen modalized into promise [would Heidegger protest?] [see S p. 93-4]

EM.content: Derrida on privilege of spoken language in Heidegger [I’ll study it elsewhere?] leads back to Being as presence, Anwesenheit > but, is also erased when Heidegger announces a Wesen that wouldn’t be Anwesen (see OS [?])
EM.linkedContent: Derrida on privilege of spoken language in Heidegger [I’ll study it elsewhere?] leads back to Being as presence, Anwesenheit > but, is also erased when Heidegger announces a Wesen that wouldn’t be Anwesen (see OS [?])

SEC.content: isn’t iterability of writing also in speech and in all experience? > never permits unity of self-identity
SEC.linkedContent: isn’t iterability of writing also in speech and in all experience? > never permits unity of self-identity

PP.content: problem of writing linked to problem of “knowing by heart” [speech] > need pharmakon, biblia, if one has not learned speech by heart
PP.linkedContent: problem of writing linked to problem of “knowing by heart” [speech] > need pharmakon, biblia, if one has not learned speech by heart

PP.content: in speech, son & father remain together
in Ancient Egypt, power of speech is one with power of creation: “the egg of the great cackler”
PP.linkedContent: in Ancient Egypt, power of speech is one with power of creation: “the egg of the great cackler”

PP.content: pharmakon is liquid (opposites pass more easily btwn each other), water [see Laws on protecting water], everything in sperm which overflows wastefully (se dépense sans réserve) [living speech: non-diverted seminal potency]
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon is liquid (opposites pass more easily btwn each other), water [see Laws on protecting water], everything in sperm which overflows wastefully (se dépense sans réserve) [living speech: non-diverted seminal potency]

PP.content: Plato makes living speech a psychic graphē, a writing of alētheia
PP.linkedContent: Plato makes living speech a psychic graphē, a writing of alētheia

VM.content: for Levinas, face is original unity of glance and speech, thought is speech > immediately face
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, face is original unity of glance and speech, thought is speech > immediately face

VM.content: Blanchot: preeminence of oral discourse, tranquil humanist, nearness to speaker, socratic speech
VM.linkedContent: Blanchot: preeminence of oral discourse, tranquil humanist, nearness to speaker, socratic speech

VM.content: for Levinas, writing must be secondary to living, original speech, w/out it there could be grammar/lexicon w/out language > cybernetics, electronics
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, writing must be secondary to living, original speech, w/out it there could be grammar/lexicon w/out language > cybernetics, electronics

VM.content: speech of God distinguishes Levinas from Socrates in Phaedrus
VM.linkedContent: speech of God distinguishes Levinas from Socrates in Phaedrus

VM.content: for Levinas, can only, must only, speak to Other; must use the vocative (never accusative which would objectify Other), bursting forth, very raising up of speech
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, can only, must only, speak to Other; must use the vocative (never accusative which would objectify Other), bursting forth, very raising up of speech

VM.content: [by following Levinas closely] isn’t speech by its essence rooted in space?
VM.linkedContent: [by following Levinas closely] isn’t speech by its essence rooted in space?

VP.content: living speech (spirituality of breath as phonē) preserves ideality and presence [in face of language’s game of presence/absence]
VP.linkedContent: living speech (spirituality of breath as phonē) preserves ideality and presence [in face of language’s game of presence/absence]

VP.content: the voice simulates the “keeping watch (la garde)” over presence, and that the history of spoken language as archive of this simulation prevents us from considering [its contradiction], prevents us from describing this simulation, the infinite complexity of its structure as phantasm
VP.linkedContent: the voice simulates the “keeping watch (la garde)” over presence, and that the history of spoken language as archive of this simulation prevents us from considering [its contradiction], prevents us from describing this simulation, the infinite complexity of its structure as phantasm

VP.content: necessary privilege of phonē, originative affinity w/ voice not logos in general > phenomenological voice: breath, transcendental flesh, transforms body of word into flesh, Körper into Leib, a geistige Leiblichkeit [see p. 70]> the “grip (prise)” phenomenology preserves itself w/in
VP.linkedContent: necessary privilege of phonē, originative affinity w/ voice not logos in general > phenomenological voice: breath, transcendental flesh, transforms body of word into flesh, Körper into Leib, a geistige Leiblichkeit [see p. 70]> the “grip (prise)” phenomenology preserves itself w/in

VP.content: for Husserl, ex-pression moves outside (an absolutely original outside, neither nature, world, nor exterior to consciousness), toward an ideal ob-ject, but remains w/in “solitary life,” w/in noetico-noematic sphere of consciousness, remains in the “phenomenological” voice
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, ex-pression moves outside (an absolutely original outside, neither nature, world, nor exterior to consciousness), toward an ideal ob-ject, but remains w/in “solitary life,” w/in noetico-noematic sphere of consciousness, remains in the “phenomenological” voice

VP.content: [now] phenomenological [absolute] “silence” of self-relation must exclude not only the other (indication) but also expressive language itself > agency of voice btwn these 2 exclusions
VP.linkedContent: [now] phenomenological [absolute] “silence” of self-relation must exclude not only the other (indication) but also expressive language itself > agency of voice btwn these 2 exclusions

VP.content: le sens du verbe “être” entretient avec le mot, c’est-à dire avec l’unité de la phonè et du sense, un rapport tout à fait singulier
VP.linkedContent: le sens du verbe “être” entretient avec le mot, c’est-à dire avec l’unité de la phonè et du sense, un rapport tout à fait singulier

VP.content: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same
VP.linkedContent: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same

VP.content: voice is ideal because it hears itself, because subject does not have to pass outside himself; it appears to have no spatial relation (unlike writing) > it is this “appearance,” the transcendent dignity of phenomenological voice that we must examine, cannot deconstruct sans s'enfoncer, en tâtonnant à travers les concepts hérités, vers l'innommable [plunge towards the unnamable]
VP.linkedContent: voice is ideal because it hears itself, because subject does not have to pass outside himself; it appears to have no spatial relation (unlike writing) > it is this “appearance,” the transcendent dignity of phenomenological voice that we must examine, cannot deconstruct sans s'enfoncer, en tâtonnant à travers les concepts hérités, vers l'innommable [plunge towards the unnamable]

VP.content: voice’s immediate erasure, its diaphaneity, makes phoneme most ideal of signs
VP.linkedContent: voice’s immediate erasure, its diaphaneity, makes phoneme most ideal of signs

VP.content: phoneme gives itself as mastered ideality of the phenomenon
VP.linkedContent: phoneme gives itself as mastered ideality of the phenomenon

VP.content: presence to itself of animating act, this intimacy of life to itself is why we say speech is alive, we hear our voice, thus the deaf are dumb
VP.linkedContent: presence to itself of animating act, this intimacy of life to itself is why we say speech is alive, we hear our voice, thus the deaf are dumb

VP.content: in contrast to speech, reflection and touch exteriorize
VP.linkedContent: in contrast to speech, reflection and touch exteriorize

VP.content: pure auto-affection as universality, absolute reduction of space, unity of sound and voice, unites or escapes distinction btwn intramundanity and transcendentality
VP.linkedContent: pure auto-affection as universality, absolute reduction of space, unity of sound and voice, unites or escapes distinction btwn intramundanity and transcendentality

VP.content: voice is consciousness, hearing-oneself-speak
VP.linkedContent: voice is consciousness, hearing-oneself-speak

VP.content: voice as signifier has absolute proximity to the signified
VP.linkedContent: voice as signifier has absolute proximity to the signified

VP.content: Husserl tormented by possibility that writing inhabits inside of speech, itself at work in intimacy of thought
VP.linkedContent: Husserl tormented by possibility that writing inhabits inside of speech, itself at work in intimacy of thought

VP.content: [commentary > interpretation] auto-affection as voice assumes a pure difference dividing self-presence, makes reduction of world, space, impossible; yet, must pass through reduction “in order to recapture difference in closest proximity to itself”: in closest proximity to movement of differance
VP.linkedContent: [commentary > interpretation] auto-affection as voice assumes a pure difference dividing self-presence, makes reduction of world, space, impossible; yet, must pass through reduction “in order to recapture difference in closest proximity to itself”: in closest proximity to movement of differance

VP.content: movement of differance produces transcendental subject
VP.linkedContent: movement of differance produces transcendental subject

VP.content: Husserl ties concept of pure auto-affection to time
VP.linkedContent: Husserl ties concept of pure auto-affection to time

VP.content: once presence in absolute infinity (unity of concept, logos, and consciousness in a voice w/out differance) appears to itself as its own death, this history is closed
VP.linkedContent: once presence in absolute infinity (unity of concept, logos, and consciousness in a voice w/out differance) appears to itself as its own death, this history is closed

VP.content: une voix sans différance, une voix sans écriture est à la fois absolument vive et absolument morte
VP.linkedContent: une voix sans différance, une voix sans écriture est à la fois absolument vive et absolument morte

VP.content: phoneme is the phenomenon of the labyrinth, soaring up to the sun of presence, it is the path of Icarus
VP.linkedContent: phoneme is the phenomenon of the labyrinth, soaring up to the sun of presence, it is the path of Icarus

S.content: Heidegger’s Gespräch w/ Trakl: language speaks in speech, speaks about itself, refers to itself by deferring itself
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Gespräch w/ Trakl: language speaks in speech, speaks about itself, refers to itself by deferring itself

TC.content: speech’s rational transparency purloins the body, glossopoeia (not yet discourse, not a shout); for Artaud, word is cadaver of psychic speech, wants to renew spellbinding unseparatedness of language/speech’s power > hieroglyphics
TC.linkedContent: speech’s rational transparency purloins the body, glossopoeia (not yet discourse, not a shout); for Artaud, word is cadaver of psychic speech, wants to renew spellbinding unseparatedness of language/speech’s power > hieroglyphics

PPHS.content: theory of sign on basis of being-present, authority of l’être-en-vue: telos of reappropriation [see POOF p. 65], coordination of sign & light of parousia, speaking logos as close as possible to itself in concept & consciousness
PPHS.linkedContent: theory of sign on basis of being-present, authority of l’être-en-vue: telos of reappropriation [see POOF p. 65], coordination of sign & light of parousia, speaking logos as close as possible to itself in concept & consciousness

PPHS.content: in Peri Hermeneias [Aristotle spells out logo-phonocentrism]: spoken words (ta en tēi phōnēi) are symbols of mental experiences, written words are symbols of spoken words, mental experiences are the same for all
PPHS.linkedContent: in Peri Hermeneias [Aristotle spells out logo-phonocentrism]: spoken words (ta en tēi phōnēi) are symbols of mental experiences, written words are symbols of spoken words, mental experiences are the same for all

PPHS.content: authority of voice: coordinated w/ entire Hegelian system: its archeology, teleology, eschatology, its will to parousia > process of sign is an Aufhebung, negativity
PPHS.linkedContent: authority of voice: coordinated w/ entire Hegelian system: its archeology, teleology, eschatology, its will to parousia > process of sign is an Aufhebung, negativity

PPHS.content: for Derrida, contents of semiology cannot be exhausted by the metaphysical theory which regulates bedeuten (meaning) by the telos of speech
PPHS.linkedContent: for Derrida, contents of semiology cannot be exhausted by the metaphysical theory which regulates bedeuten (meaning) by the telos of speech

PPHS.content: for Hegel, signifying substance is sound, “substance of expression” [glossematicians], most proper to be produced as time itself, sound relève from naturalness, linked to spirit’s relation to itself, the voice
PPHS.linkedContent: for Hegel, signifying substance is sound, “substance of expression” [glossematicians], most proper to be produced as time itself, sound relève from naturalness, linked to spirit’s relation to itself, the voice

PPHS.content: vocal note (Ton) is both intelligence, spirit, and natural (anthropological), growing out of its own naturalness, idea manifests in erfüllte Äusserung (full, adequate utterance)
PPHS.linkedContent: vocal note (Ton) is both intelligence, spirit, and natural (anthropological), growing out of its own naturalness, idea manifests in erfüllte Äusserung (full, adequate utterance)

PPHS.content: voice is the hinge btwn psychology & anthropology
PPHS.linkedContent: voice is the hinge btwn psychology & anthropology

PPHS.content: speech does not abandon the inside on the outside like writing, it confers presence
PPHS.linkedContent: speech does not abandon the inside on the outside like writing, it confers presence

PPHS.content: acc. Hegel, hearing more ideal than sight, double negation, i.e. sound (Ton)> inner vibration (inneren Erzitterns) of body, breath [trembling (of sound) prioritized by Hegel?]
PPHS.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, hearing more ideal than sight, double negation, i.e. sound (Ton)> inner vibration (inneren Erzitterns) of body, breath [trembling (of sound) prioritized by Hegel?]

PPHS.content: teleological concept of sound [in Hegel]: logocentrism
PPHS.linkedContent: teleological concept of sound [in Hegel]: logocentrism

PPHS.content: Hegel: human voice sounds w/out external impulse, out of one’s own feelings, spirit
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: human voice sounds w/out external impulse, out of one’s own feelings, spirit

PPHS.content: sign is essence of symbol, the symbol past, both in turn relevé by living concept, language w/out language, language become thing itself, voice murmuring in greatest proximity to spirit, identity of the name, of Being
PPHS.linkedContent: sign is essence of symbol, the symbol past, both in turn relevé by living concept, language w/out language, language become thing itself, voice murmuring in greatest proximity to spirit, identity of the name, of Being

PPHS.content: [Hegel on calculation and machine] a “living,” “thinking,” “speaking” protest against repetition
PPHS.linkedContent: [Hegel on calculation and machine] a “living,” “thinking,” “speaking” protest against repetition

T.content: Being [one reading of it] assures permeable/transparent continuity, logos posits/negates itself en laissant sourdre sa propre voix
T.linkedContent: Being [one reading of it] assures permeable/transparent continuity, logos posits/negates itself en laissant sourdre sa propre voix

F.content: [Derrida’s speech]: feel on tongue angular cut of shattered word, et je sens alors, de ma langue, l’angle coupant d’un mot brisé
F.linkedContent: [Derrida’s speech]: feel on tongue angular cut of shattered word, et je sens alors, de ma langue, l’angle coupant d’un mot brisé

WM.content: for Aristotle, no tragedy w/out difference btwn dianoia (thought) and lexis (tone, diction, speech): this still maintains an original naturality of the figure of meaning
WM.linkedContent: for Aristotle, no tragedy w/out difference btwn dianoia (thought) and lexis (tone, diction, speech): this still maintains an original naturality of the figure of meaning

WM.content: he exists/acts w/in tragedy on condition that he speaks
WM.linkedContent: he exists/acts w/in tragedy on condition that he speaks

WM.content: for Aristotle, brutes and humans both make sounds, but only humans make sounds that can become intelligible, meaningful, sounds that become letters
WM.linkedContent: for Aristotle, brutes and humans both make sounds, but only humans make sounds that can become intelligible, meaningful, sounds that become letters

WM.content: for Aristotle, the letter, the stoikheion, has no meaning in itself, but is capable of entering formation/composition of a phōnē sēmantikē, it is the atom of the voice (phōnē adiairetos)
WM.linkedContent: for Aristotle, the letter, the stoikheion, has no meaning in itself, but is capable of entering formation/composition of a phōnē sēmantikē, it is the atom of the voice (phōnē adiairetos)

WM.content: Aristotle’s definition of noun, the element of metaphor, is a theory of the name, articulated w/ ontology > value of metaphor systematically chained to values of discourse, voice, meaning, resemblance, or to logos, phōnē sēmantikē, sēmainein, onoma, mimēsis, homoiosis
WM.linkedContent: Aristotle’s definition of noun, the element of metaphor, is a theory of the name, articulated w/ ontology > value of metaphor systematically chained to values of discourse, voice, meaning, resemblance, or to logos, phōnē sēmantikē, sēmainein, onoma, mimēsis, homoiosis

WM.content: Aristotle: human voice is organ most apt to imitate
WM.linkedContent: Aristotle: human voice is organ most apt to imitate

DS.content: specularity of eidos > logos—speech < mirroring [repetition ordered by resemblance (homoiōsis), doubling as duplication]
DS.linkedContent: specularity of eidos > logos—speech < mirroring [repetition ordered by resemblance (homoiōsis), doubling as duplication]

DS.content: supplement in Mallarmé (not unilateral movement, like in Rousseau, which loses warmth of spoken word): c’est l’excès d’un signifiant qui, en son dedans, supplée l’espace et répète l’ouverture
DS.linkedContent: supplement in Mallarmé (not unilateral movement, like in Rousseau, which loses warmth of spoken word): c’est l’excès d’un signifiant qui, en son dedans, supplée l’espace et répète l’ouverture

DS.content: le son OR, le SON or (by way of lateral unconscious pressure)
DS.linkedContent: le son OR, le SON or (by way of lateral unconscious pressure)

POS.content: juridically decisive for Derrida to pose question of privilege of voice in Western metaphysics, represented in its most critical, vigilant form: Husserl’s transcendental phenomenology
POS.linkedContent: juridically decisive for Derrida to pose question of privilege of voice in Western metaphysics, represented in its most critical, vigilant form: Husserl’s transcendental phenomenology

POS.content: voice is consciousness itself when phonē is signifying substance > signifier and signified unite, signifier erases itself, exteriority of signifier reduced by spontaneous proximity
POS.linkedContent: voice is consciousness itself when phonē is signifying substance > signifier and signified unite, signifier erases itself, exteriority of signifier reduced by spontaneous proximity

POS.content: grammatology must liberate mathematization of language (which phonocentrism has always critiqued, for limiting that which links logos to phonē), but must be wary of Leibniz’s type of unifying, simple, mathematical language, which appeals to divine logos
POS.linkedContent: grammatology must liberate mathematization of language (which phonocentrism has always critiqued, for limiting that which links logos to phonē), but must be wary of Leibniz’s type of unifying, simple, mathematical language, which appeals to divine logos

ATIA.content: Lacan distinguishes btwn animal sexual pretense (feinte) and the deception (tromperie) of speech
ATIA.linkedContent: Lacan distinguishes btwn animal sexual pretense (feinte) and the deception (tromperie) of speech

FS.content: the possibility of speech & of being always already w/in it [historicity?], la répétition enfin avouée, extended to the dimensions of world culture—[of] a surprise incomparable to any other, a surprise responsible for Western thought
FS.linkedContent: the possibility of speech & of being always already w/in it [historicity?], la répétition enfin avouée, extended to the dimensions of world culture—[of] a surprise incomparable to any other, a surprise responsible for Western thought

FS.content: consciousness takes on meaning by way of consciousness of nothing, thus is speech brought forth > car la pensée de la chose comme ce qu'elle est se confond déjà avec l'expérience de la pure parole; et celle-ci avec l'expérience elle-même
FS.linkedContent: consciousness takes on meaning by way of consciousness of nothing, thus is speech brought forth > car la pensée de la chose comme ce qu'elle est se confond déjà avec l'expérience de la pure parole; et celle-ci avec l'expérience elle-même

FS.content: doesn’t pure speech require inscription, isn’t it a privileged representation of inscription? just like Leibniz’s essence requires existence (pushes out toward world), power <small>> </small>act?
FS.linkedContent: doesn’t pure speech require inscription, isn’t it a privileged representation of inscription? just like Leibniz’s essence requires existence (pushes out toward world), power > act?

FS.content: God of Leibniz does not know the anguish of choice, only one book distributed through all books, God’s Will always chooses the “best”
FS.linkedContent: God of Leibniz does not know the anguish of choice, only one book distributed through all books, God’s Will always chooses the “best”

FS.content: writing, not a determined pathos, an empirical state of writer, but responsibility of angustia: [Derrida is privileging a power of equivocality over creativity of classical God, anguish connoting a narrowing, a loss of breath, a restriction, constraint, and thus the anguish of choice]
FS.linkedContent: writing, not a determined pathos, an empirical state of writer, but responsibility of angustia: [Derrida is privileging a power of equivocality over creativity of classical God, anguish connoting a narrowing, a loss of breath, a restriction, constraint, and thus the anguish of choice]

FS.content: absence & haunting of divine sign (Jewish God) [cf. GOD], anguish of Hebraic ruah (pneuma), regulates modern books/criticism/aesthetics
FS.linkedContent: absence & haunting of divine sign (Jewish God) [cf. GOD], anguish of Hebraic ruah (pneuma), regulates modern books/criticism/aesthetics

FS.content: Heidegger on pure speech: can’t be perceived in the rigor of its essence on the basis of its “character-as-sign (Zeichencharakter)”
FS.linkedContent: Heidegger on pure speech: can’t be perceived in the rigor of its essence on the basis of its “character-as-sign (Zeichencharakter)”

CHM.content: for Descartes, thinking and saying what is clear & distinct is same thing—Derrida adds that, for St. Anselm, the insipiens, the insane man, couldn’t think because he couldn’t think what he said > madness as voluble silence that couldn’t think its own words
CHM.linkedContent: for Descartes, thinking and saying what is clear & distinct is same thing—Derrida adds that, for St. Anselm, the insipiens, the insane man, couldn’t think because he couldn’t think what he said > madness as voluble silence that couldn’t think its own words

CHM.content: speech, confined to temporal rhythm of crisis & reawakening [re: Cogito as madness, then against madness] opens discourse by making a mockery, humiliating madman w/in us: movement of temporalization, historicity in general, reign of finite thought must stay close to this violence to liberate and live as speech > madman as fool of logos, of father, king, master
CHM.linkedContent: speech, confined to temporal rhythm of crisis & reawakening [re: Cogito as madness, then against madness] opens discourse by making a mockery, humiliating madman w/in us: movement of temporalization, historicity in general, reign of finite thought must stay close to this violence to liberate and live as speech > madman as fool of logos, of father, king, master

Gii.content: Heidegger: only when man speaks does he think, not the other way around, as metaphysics still believes
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger: only when man speaks does he think, not the other way around, as metaphysics still believes

Gii.content: in seminar on Parmenides, Heidegger translates pragma as Handlung, so pragmata present themselves as Zuhandenes, Vorhandenes, w/in reach of hand > only a man w/ speech & thus hands can pray, murder, greet, give thanks, make oaths, signal (Wink)
Gii.linkedContent: in seminar on Parmenides, Heidegger translates pragma as Handlung, so pragmata present themselves as Zuhandenes, Vorhandenes, w/in reach of hand > only a man w/ speech & thus hands can pray, murder, greet, give thanks, make oaths, signal (Wink)

Gii.content: writing is hand-writing in its essence, makes word manifest, monstre; co-belonging of hand & speech: ability to produce monstres that disclose concealment [still a phono-logocentrism, but one where handwriting is immediately bound to speech]
Gii.linkedContent: writing is hand-writing in its essence, makes word manifest, monstre; co-belonging of hand & speech: ability to produce monstres that disclose concealment [still a phono-logocentrism, but one where handwriting is immediately bound to speech]

Gii.content: hand speaks by way of “necessity,” chreon, usage, Brauch [?] > if the chreōn allows one to think the present in its presence, if der Brauch is “the gathering”—then, before all technology, surgery, le main n’y est pas pour rien
Gii.linkedContent: hand speaks by way of “necessity,” chreon, usage, Brauch [?] > if the chreōn allows one to think the present in its presence, if der Brauch is “the gathering”—then, before all technology, surgery, le main n’y est pas pour rien

REST.content: if police there is (and isn’t there always?) > Derrida polices too [?], “close reading,” counterpolices [?] oldest, most dogmatic, sinisterly authoritarian programs, massive meidatizing machines: pre-text of perception, of bare hands (mains nue), of real history, of living speech (vous enferme en tout hâte dans un prétendu hors-texte)
REST.linkedContent: if police there is (and isn’t there always?) > Derrida polices too [?], “close reading,” counterpolices [?] oldest, most dogmatic, sinisterly authoritarian programs, massive meidatizing machines: pre-text of perception, of bare hands (mains nue), of real history, of living speech (vous enferme en tout hâte dans un prétendu hors-texte)

DST.content: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech
DST.linkedContent: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech

LI.content: Searle explains [to Derrida] that from standpoint of iterability no difference btwn speech & writing > Derrida responds: it is so “clear,” I am so “aware,” idea was indispensable to SEC
LI.linkedContent: Searle explains [to Derrida] that from standpoint of iterability no difference btwn speech & writing > Derrida responds: it is so “clear,” I am so “aware,” idea was indispensable to SEC

TN.content: interruption of auto-affection of mouth imparts speech [?]

E.content: Kant analogizes division of Fine-Arts w/ the mode of expression man possess in Sprechen (not w/out slight embarrassment) [this serves a teleological function]
E.linkedContent: Kant analogizes division of Fine-Arts w/ the mode of expression man possess in Sprechen (not w/out slight embarrassment) [this serves a teleological function]

E.content: for Kant, poetry’s privilege is not just in the interiorizing structure of (mouth to ear) hearing oneself speak, but in sincerity, faithful adequation [its truth]; these values are not immediately moral > morality itself derives its value from full presence/full speech
E.linkedContent: for Kant, poetry’s privilege is not just in the interiorizing structure of (mouth to ear) hearing oneself speak, but in sincerity, faithful adequation [its truth]; these values are not immediately moral > morality itself derives its value from full presence/full speech

BSi.content: fable, for, fari, to speak, to say, fabula, something said > make so as to know: 1) bring knowledge to the other 2) give impression, effect, of knowledge, of knowing, simulacrum of knowing: a savoir-faire to “faire” savoir where there is no knowing worthy of the name
BSi.linkedContent: fable, for, fari, to speak, to say, fabula, something said > make so as to know: 1) bring knowledge to the other 2) give impression, effect, of knowledge, of knowing, simulacrum of knowing: a savoir-faire to “faire” savoir where there is no knowing worthy of the name

BSi.content: Valéry: “<small>IN THE BEGINNING WAS THE FABLE</small> [speech], it will always be”
BSi.linkedContent: Valéry: “IN THE BEGINNING WAS THE FABLE [speech], it will always be”

OG.content: history of metaphysics as history of truth, as the truth of truth, the debasement of writing, its repression outside (hors) of “full (pleine)” speech
OG.linkedContent: history of metaphysics as history of truth, as the truth of truth, the debasement of writing, its repression outside (hors) of “full (pleine)” speech

OG.content: cybernetics & mathematics extend possibility of “message,” its no longer the written translation of a language, the transporting of a signified whose integrity remains
OG.linkedContent: cybernetics & mathematics extend possibility of “message,” its no longer the written translation of a language, the transporting of a signified whose integrity remains

OG.content: Aristotle’s phono-logocentrism: voice, spoken symbols, immediately proximate to the universal language of mental experience (pathēmata tes psychēs), closest to the thing, the signified
OG.linkedContent: Aristotle’s phono-logocentrism: voice, spoken symbols, immediately proximate to the universal language of mental experience (pathēmata tes psychēs), closest to the thing, the signified

OG.content: Hegel privileges sound (speech, voice), because it is a hearing of an interior vibration
OG.linkedContent: Hegel privileges sound (speech, voice), because it is a hearing of an interior vibration

OG.content: voice, phonè, s’entendre-parler, s’affecte lui-même (hearing-oneself-speak, affecting oneself), ideality

OG.content: phonocentrism se confond (merges) w/ onto-theology, produces these subdeterminations of presence: sight as eidos, substance/essence/existence (ousia), temporal presence as point (stigmè) of now (nun), consciousness, cogito, subjectivity, co-presence of other & self…
OG.linkedContent: phonocentrism se confond (merges) w/ onto-theology, produces these subdeterminations of presence: sight as eidos, substance/essence/existence (ousia), temporal presence as point (stigmè) of now (nun), consciousness, cogito, subjectivity, co-presence of other & self…

OG.content: unity of phonè, glossa, logos, l’unité articulée du son et du sens dans la phonie > this presupposition prior to all oppositions > re: this unity, writing always derivative: “sign of sign” says Aristotle, Rousseau, Hegel
OG.linkedContent: unity of phonè, glossa, logos, l’unité articulée du son et du sens dans la phonie > this presupposition prior to all oppositions > re: this unity, writing always derivative: “sign of sign” says Aristotle, Rousseau, Hegel

OG.content: one must exorcise (that is, conjurer) writing (mask, perversion, disguise, debauchery) w/ the good word (bonne parole)

OG.content: for Plato (Phaedrus 277e), play, childishness, paidia of writing opposed to adult gravity (spoudè) of speech

OG.content: unity of sound and meaning: reassuring closing of play

OG.content: Rousseau: voice answers hearing

OG.content: Vico was rare believer in contemporaneity of origin of writing/speech

OG.content: ethics of speech: delusion of presence mastered

FV.content: [phonematic limitation of letter, phonē spared divisibility] voice: spontaneous self-presence one can retain (garder) w/out paper, w/out envelope, always available (disponible) > Lacan’s not attentive to writing w/in the voice, before the letter

FV.content: for Lacan, analyst links truth to power of speech: power of communication as a contract btwn 2 present things

FV.content: Lacan’s “True Speech”: “subject is founded in this act as being the other”

FV.content: [vis-à-vis Lacan] present speech, anamnesis, irreplaceable properness, inalienable singularity > disqualification of recording or repetition in the name of the act of living (present speech): a well known program

FV.content: full speech, contracts only w/ itself, system of truth > Lacan not proposing crude readjustment [i.e. American psychology] but rarity à la Heideggerian Eigentlichkeit

FV.content: acc. Lacan, the [full] speech which constitutes/forms the subject is forbidden to him > it speaks everywhere it can be read in his Being [this antinomy is very antinomy of the meaning Freud gave to unconscious]: true speech always operates through mediation of another subject, it is open to chain w/out end re: speeches in which dialectic of recognition is concretely realized in human community [?]

FV.content: Lacan advocates reconciliation (Versohnung), re: reintegration [of letter?]
Lacan: when patient can speak to you (analyst) about himself [sic]—analysis is over
